docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Re ''New Day for Morning-After Pill?'' (editorial, Aug. 2): It is bewildering that the F.D.A.'s greatest concern gumming up approval of over-the-counter status of Plan B emergency contraception is neither medical nor scientific but rather how to keep teenagers from getting their hands on it.
docs.abstract: Letter from Mary Alice Carr, Vice President of Naral Pro-Choice New York, contends it makes no sense to keep emergency contraception such as Plan B from teenagers (Aug 2 editorial)
docs.snippet: To the Editor:     Re ''New Day for Morning-After Pill?'' (editorial, Aug. 2):     It is bewildering that the F.D.A.'s greatest concern gumming up approval of over-the-counter status of Plan B emergency contraception is neither medical nor scientific...
